m_szDocSumamry: Big Banks Inflate Solar Project Value to Boost Tax Credits July 18th, 2011 by John Farrell   Solar leasing has offered thousands of homeowners a “no money down” route to go  solar, broadening participation in the distributed generation  revolution.  Unfortunately, this revolution has been co-opted by high  finance.  Big banks have been able to write off millions in taxes by  over-reporting the cost of financed solar PV projects in what may be the  country’s next banking scandal.
